decision.reasoning: Key stats driving decision: Seahawks have superior regular season total first downs (339 vs opponents 291), dominant rushing first downs (125 vs 83), and elite explosive-play differential (+4.7%, NFL best), indicating a balanced, explosive offense/defense combo. However, opponents nearly matched Seahawks in passing first downs (176 vs 179), and Seahawks 3rd-down conversion is middling (82/206 ~40%). Patriots offense leads NFL in explosive creation rate (13.6%), ranks 4th in some efficiency metric (+2.8%), with QB Maye posting MVP-caliber season (17.3% tight-window throws, 4th-highest). Patriots playoff dominance is superior: 16-3 WC vs Chargers, 28-16 Div vs Texans, 10-7 Conf Champ vs Broncosâ€”low-scoring, defensive grinds (total points in Conf: 17), proving clutch road warriors (3-1 vs AFC North). Seahawks face "best pass offense yet" in playoffs per reports, but Pats D holds foes low. Market overprices Seahawks at 54.7%; stats favor Pats edge in QB/playoffs/explosives vs Seahawks' regular-season rushing. Heavy bet on mispricing.
